fxwpdln6Fi293dd4XtymwA.text: Don't let the name fool you, this place is definitely more tex-mex than Mexican. The margaritas are strong and the food is tasty (regardless of its authenticity). Our waiter was really friendly and was on top of our empty glasses throughout lunch.

WCofdScKyqMjFNyBsTC7Jw.text: Visited here at lunch with friends. Pre ordered due to only having an hour break. Food and table was ready on our arrival and service was very good. Not the authentic mexican food that I am used to and slightly over priced for the quality of fare, however as a quick lunch bite its adequate.  Ps I liked pinatas

iNcQnjdKM_vfDSZbP3_GFA.text: OMG The Chili Con Carne here was sooooooo freaking tasty it was unreal. The rice was like spicy and orange, perfect amount of jalapenos and it was such a big, satisfying portion! Really worth the price and would love to try other things on the menu too!!

gIlr8iMOPekKYEbHudn7KA.text: What a shame... You live in Scotland all your life, coming to this place, thinking you're eating decent mexican, then you come to the states and all your dreams are shattered.   Tip to the Management: Hire REAL hispanic people to cook for you

ta6jIpoEOpmTkMOu_J1jSA.text: Terrible food at ridiculous prices. They served us what appears to be Uncle Ben's Mexican rice, only Uncle Ben's is better because at least it's cooked all the way through. Quesadilla arrived with blob of runny sour cream on top and a smear of salsa. Restaurant was nearly empty, so there was no reason for our food to be sloppily put together. Beef burrito was literally beef, and nothing but beef, wrapped in a flour tortilla. Quesadilla was filled with watery chicken and almost no cheese. Also, quesadilla was not cooked well enough that you could cut off a piece and pick it up as you can with most.   Server asked us how our food was without really giving us time to answer, and never returned.   Pluses: Bathrooms were clean. Cheesy decor. (Pinatas? Really?)   Really irritated with how high the prices were with quality that low, especially during a recession when eating out is a special treat.

3anOKE0QK1T_0PxEpMh7LQ.text: This is probably my favourite Mexican restaurant that I've been to in Edinburgh. It's got a really nice menu, and the restaurant itself has a really good atmosphere, although it is totally decked out in rather stereotypical 'Mexican' fashion.   The service was fantastic, and the food came really soon after we ordered it. Their Margaritas are pretty damn splendid as well. I was half cut and totally stuffed by the time I left.

nsErH4PAxwQtKgAyAjnKwg.text: Not the greatest Mexican food around. Then again, this is Edinburgh...not Los Angeles, so it wasn't very shocking. For some peculiar reason or other, the South seems to have a few decent Mexican places but there's somewhat of a dearth up here. I'd actually rate this place 1-star but our server was lovely and brought us our drinks and food in a timely manner.

ttS_P7gelnRO9Ns1VP0uJA.text: A really nice, quiet restaurant right on the Royal Mile. I had the fajitas which were good and the others that I ate with all enjoyed their meals.   There isnt a whole lot to find fault with at this restaurant however it just didnt have the right atmosphere for me. I am a big fan of Mexican food and I found this place to be a bit too quiet for my taste, however this was at lunchtime and perhaps it changes in the evening.   I think Pancho Villas is mostly suited to tourists due to its location and I dont think anyone would be disappointed. The food was really tasty and I enjoyed my visit but I dont think it is somewhere that I will be visiting again in the near future.

pnOoXM-MyjD_1S9mDty_mg.text: Panchos Villas on the Royal mile as a fairly run of the mill Mexican Restaurant. Not the worst in Edinburgh, but definitely not the best I've tasted either.   The restaurant is very prettily decorated in a Mexican style, but tables are crammed in too close together, which makes it difficult to have a quiet meal without someone needing past to go to the toilet. At the weekends it can get very busy with large groups and therefore very noisy; whereas during the week it is the opposite end of the spectrum in that you could hear a pin drop.   The food was fairly standard Mexican fare and nothing that jumped out hugely. Prices were fairly reasonably, and portion sizes were good, but in all honesty i expected a little more from this place.

ymv6EZ9O5tx-G_G6ZWk8Jg.text: Have been to Pancho Villas quite a few times and most of the time it's pretty good. I love Mexican food but Edinburgh isn't the place to find the best stuff. However if you don't have your expectations too high, Pancho Villas should keep you fairly happy.   The portions aren't the most generous, but the food is tasty enough and the margaritas are excellent. I like the decor, though they could do with some soft furnishings to damp the noise down when busy. Being a bit further down the Royal Mile than most restaurants it's sometimes possible to get a table there when you can't get one further up the hill. Pancho Villas is a pretty neat place to have lunch, and they have a few items on the menu for vegetarians, which is always a bonus!

YXS5AnHM5Hkr8YIXVruu-g.text: Pancho Villas has always been a pleasurable experience for me when I have visited the Glasgow branch, but I had a totally different experience here.  While the food is supposed to be pretty much the same, I found my simple chicken fajitas to be full of gristle, limp vegetables and certainly not the sizzling platter I am used to. I actually complained, which I only do in extreme circumstances, and the waitress apologised and brought me back a new plate, another 20 minutes later. I was not a happy bunny. Not at all. The replacement wasn't much better either.  I must have got them on a bad day because the food in Pancho Villas is usually very good and well cooked. No tip was left that day!

-7iXi1OnRjkU_SvO-K1ymg.text: I really hope I just caught this restaurant on a bad day. The food was bland and tasteless, with hardly any sauce in some of the wraps. And the noise level is atrocious. Avoid.

ybNMOKC7z69AuswMp4Pqew.text: This is one of my favourite restaurants. The food is lovely and the staff friendly and efficient. I used to love going to this restaurant when I lived in Edinburgh. They have a great menu with alot of choice. They have a good selection of drinks to choose from including some nice cocktails if you want to indulge. It is in a good location on the royal mile and has been busy whenever I have been there on an evening. The restaurant is cosy and quite romantic and you don't feel too close to any other diners in the restaurant. They also have some lovely puddings if you still have room after your main course!

IQEJgysaAZpwqcsv0ezZ9Q.text: Who would have though orange and pink would work? Well, at this Mexican restaurant it certainly does, and with the beautiful tiling and bright cocktails the experience is positively technicoloured. Another unlikely combination is that of chilli and chocolate, found in at least one of the excellent (and generous) dishes. At least it means you can save on a pudding. I do not advise this, however, and strongly urge everybody to sample them all, at the same time.

RmW8s5fMleD5Zy684SbIZA.text: very disappointed with the food we had , especially poor was the rustic lamb dish that a visitor to our city was presented with - it was overly done to the point you could taste the carbonised taint. it is an absolute shame that the lovely waiting staff have to be let down by such poor service from the kitchen. the food was also just warm enough eat. thoroughly disappointed and will not be back ever.

pzLrJKBALA3hreG2Bbrsig.text: I never post reviews but this meal was so good I just thought I had to. We had a family of four, we went in early for Scotland, about 6 PM and the place was empty except for us. The service was excellent and the food was amazing.  I had a meal called the lamb Rustica and the server said that it is not a True Mexican dish but a favorite of the owner who is also the chef this particular evening.  The Sangria was right on the money.  The kids were happy, Mom was happy, what more do you want!

ai0jAGtZZZZ7usmVwWEyQg.text: We were getting a little homesick for San Diego and tired of anything with chips, so we decided to try Pancho Villa's. Really pretty good for being on the touristy Royal Mile! Our waitress was super sweet and attentive. I had the salmon with mango salsa over rice, with a side salad , nicely dressed. Hubby had steak fajitas. We also had guacamole with chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grilled salmon with mango salsa, over rice.
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak fajitas

vJnpxQM9zevZAm-K008aHQ.text: I've eaten Mexican food in Mexico, the US, Canada, Australia and Europe but this place serves the best Mexican food I've had outside of Mexico. The guacamole was good, the lamb tacos and chipotle chicken were great and the steak was excellent. Decent Cadillac margaritas after a long, tiring day on the road of traveling hit the spot. Service was great as well and the prices were very reasonable for this part of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

BC-z2JWeoz5mVfaUe2ShMA.text: I was really craving some Mexican food on our trip. We found this restaurant near the area we were exploring. As a Mexican, and understanding how hard it is to get all the fresh products needed for alot of dishes in Scotland, I think they are doing great under the circumstances. We had fajitas and enchiladas, they were good. My husband says he had the best coffee there. The owner and her daughter helped us, they were very attentive and helpful. They also recommended activities and Scottish food to try.

MQ7dbs27Bu01qCQjcqM3sg.text: Dreadful in every possible way. There is nothing Mexican or even Tex-mex about this place. The food is just wrong, the drinks are wrong and the wait staff are shockingly ignorant about the menu which is probably ok as there is nothing you want.  The pico de Gallo is 95% onion and zero lime. The rustic lamb is who the f knows. The costillas are covered in what can only be described as marmalade, the tortillas soup is more like lentil soup and the margarita is weird.  Will not be back. Thanks

2tlxQ0Oj8Uq_pN7-KANHOw.text: Have been here forever for lunch during work and only managed to put a review now.  The most important thing during work lunch is that the food comes out quick.  This place does that and that is why it is great for lunch.  Most of the food here may have been prepared in advance but they are still fresh and flavourful.  The food here is sold tapas style and this gives us the flexibility of choosing a few to share amongst ourselves.  The staff here who serves us remembers us and always know what we want to eat.  Very friendly staff and provided very good recommendations too.  Honestly, I won't say it is the best Mexican in town but it has always fulfilled my week lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zQVw3Q3Lorne6bmSU1xYWg.text: As I was walking down Royal Mile I decided to give a try to Pancho Villa's Mexican restaurant. At around 1pm on a Friday the place was 40% occupied with a nice crowd. Front of house/waiter Pablo greeted me in no time at all, getting me a table and menu in seconds, which was cool as I was kind of starving. I ordered the Sopes, petite corn cakes topped with beans and potato & chorizo as a starter. They were tasty, crunchy and leaving a flavoursome after taste of corn that reminded me "humita" (savoury steamed fresh corn cakes) dishes that I tried in the Entre Rios province of Argentina.  After that I attacked a delicious Carne Enchilada with the shredded beef; spicy with the right level of "hotness" that allows you to taste the added herb flavours in all its glory, all of that topped with abundant melted cheese. The only minor downside of the whole experience was that portions' presentations were a bit lacklustre and on the smallish side of the scale.  Kudos to attentive and efficient waiter Pablo who delivered a very good service.  Pancho Villa's prices are very affordable considering its High Street/Royal Mile location. Will certainly go back for a re-fill any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

_vGlxMOOt3Z_2Khp1McnGA.text: I don't know why this place has such low reviews, but as most of them are a few years old, I think management must have made some improvements because I LOVE this place!  Maybe my knowledge of what makes Mexican food isn't very big, but I know what tasty food is like, and this place does exactly that! I've been here twice now, and both times had an excellent evening!  I had the cracked crab enchiladas and a tequila sticky toffee pudding for dessert. The cracked crab enchiladas were very good, but the dessert was A-MA-ZING! We had some red wine to go with dinner, it could have been a little colder, as it was definitely warmer than room temperature, but no biggie.   They also have a selection of 6 different tequila's, and a list of cocktails, which are really good! The decor is very bright and a little cheesy, but fun nonetheless. The staff is always attentive and we were served quickly and with a smile.  Would recommend this place to anyone in need of some Mexican food! :)

hpXEpXfw_5qN1TqqTzY0rw.text: Decent Mexican restaurant on the Royal Mile.  Not a spectacularly good Mexican, but if you're craving for the country's fajitas, guacamole, etc.pp., you can certainly do a lot worse. I ate there in July of 2014. It's about a 7-8 minute walk down(!) from St. Giles Cathedral on the Royal Mile. The decor is simple but pleasant, the service competent and moderately friendly.  I had coriander-seasoned spare ribs as a starter (delicious) and fajitas with various sauces and onions (some assembly required, and not bad) as a mains. Can't really complain! See my photos.  As many restaurants/bistros in this touristy area, it does get busy on weeknights and weekends. So do consider a reservation. Prices at this place are rather on the competitive end of the Royal Mile restaurants, beer selection is basic. Not a place to linger I guess.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Coriander-flavored spare ribs. Delicious!
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Simple decor.
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fajitas. Not bad, but some assembly required.

0TE3tzeCYL4DuB2YZcVBAg.text: Portions are huge. I mean literally giant. We got a nachos to share and the plate was enough to make us full. Cracked crab enchiladas were very delicious, although rice could be little bit less oily.  Decor is nice and depicts the vibe of the place. Service is fine as well.

ioYtTznAiaNDPaFVW5VZDg.text: I wanted to like this place. I really did. The decor reminded my of some of my favorite Mexican places from home. Then I heard Spanish being spoken and my heart almost stopped with joy. Then the food arrived and the joy stopped. I ordered my usual chicken burrito and was disappointed from the first bite.  My burrito consisted of shredded chicken meat, which was over seasoned and tough, and that was it. No beans, no salsa, no cheese. NOTHING. I hate to tell you kids, but shredded meat does not a burrito make.  The plate also had an over abundance of dry "flavored" rice and a pitiful amount of salsa. It was really some of the worst Mexican I have had around Europe.   The reason why I gave this place two stars is because of the service. Seriously. These guys were nice, prompt, polite, and a basic joy. I would go back for beer and nachos just for them.

2XIvSoJ9ISdBM5l6ViVwIg.text: I don't think they indicated "authentic" Mexican food but after a week in the UK, any Mexican food was up consideration.  Overall, I was not disappointed.  When you're on the apposite site of the rock from Mexico I get that you have to make substitutions. First test - the salsa.  was up to par, not excellent but not yucky either. I had the barbacoa, it was excellent but wished it could have had some jalapeno slices and or some leafy garnish to add crunch.  My husband had burritos or something that was quickly devoured so i'm guessing it wasn't bad.   Service was prompt and friendly.  Prices were fair and the food was good.

nKzweJRjH6Hv1Ri_ic51ZQ.text: A great place. Good service!  Margaritas were small for a Texan but good. Order the enchiladas suizas!  Muy bueno!  We also ordered combo fajitas and the chicken quesadilla. The best though were the enchiladad!

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. This is an empty pitcher of margaritas. The glass is how small each serving is. Somewhat small!
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A happy man after eating here!
Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The bar

95vv9BTh-nI4EvVA8GX8mg.text: Pancho Villas has been around for a while, it seems to get enough business to stick around, but I am not entirely sure how... I have had better chili from several pubs and Illegal Jack's, cheaper too. Enchiladas and Fajitas were also uninspired and lacking a spice hit.  A friend said they make a great margarita, however if I need to be inebriated to enjoy the food I don't see the point of paying a restaurant price.  To use the description so handily provided by yelp; meh, I've experienced better.

xlO1zVGehZz8l7NBmLtRLg.text: So ... we've been in the UK since January and have missed real Mexican food. Consider that I had spent the last six months of 2012 in California where real Mexican food can be found just around the corner from where ever you are.   We were wandering down the Royal Mile, intending to eat at a restaurant where we had reservations only to find that they closed about 30 minutes after our reservation time. Not wanting to be rushed, we looked across the street, saw Pancho Villas, and decided to take a risk. After all, how would the UK's interpretation of Mexican food taste? Imagine my surprise and delight to have a meal similar to what I would find in southern California. Granted, ingredient substitutions are made based on what's available in the UK however considering that the owner is Mexican and some of his staff are Mexican, I appreciated finally finding tasty Mexican food in the UK.

70c8THqZlwrXHmL5v0lf9Q.text: Having walked past many times, finally decided to go in and try it out tonight.  Ordered a variety of dishes, nachos, guacamole, tortilla soup, poblano, ribs & rustic lamb. Food was ok. Nothing spectacular.  Service was nothing to write home about. We were shown to a table which still had napkins on the floor.   I don't have anything overly negative to say but don't have much positive to say either. I wouldn't choose to dine here again.

Hs5Ujc5DtZ6C4wrze7dIIA.text: Ok so I ordered the wrong thing when I came here last time. I meant to order the quesadilla but ended up with a burrito. Not a bad thing, but my buds weren't ready.  The staff wern't very attentive this time, we had to order our drinks at the bar and they came and took our order when the drinks had arrived. It was fine though.  The food was still good! The wine was a bit warm, but that's ok.   It's never really busy here, don't know why but it isn't!

lWN6Gdf212r7BOJHgFu-aQ.text: So I decided to venture from my usual Mexican restaurant on this trip to Edinburgh to try a new one.  I read the menu while I was standing outside and that's why I decided to try it.  The first waitress kept rushing me along saying, "This table is booked for 7.  Ok?"  I got it the first time.  I think I had 3 waitresses during my short dinner.  The last two, however, were very attentive and very hospitable.  I ordered a Corona to go with my meal...and it wasn't cold at all.  The Tortilla Soup was not quite what I expected, but I have to say it looked beautiful...but the taste...not sure if it was the lukewarm soup itself, the crumbled cheese, or the rock hard pieces of avocado, but it was not good.  I then ordered the Enchilada Toluca.  The menu says that there is a cream sauce, but there was definitely no sauce on this, just melted cheese on top, however I thought it was delicious, although there could have been more chorizo in the enchilada.  The rice was pretty bland, but the refried beans were wonderful.  The beans had a lot of flavor.  Overall...it wasn't the worst Mexican food I've had, but it certainly was not the best.

_SDzeit6w7BeP4VE9lUtVw.text: After having already tried Viva Mexico once, we thought we would be adventurous and try Pancho Villas, but we came away disappointed. This place has a great location and, as such, is usually busy. However, that is because it is touristy and looks inviting, but the food betrays it and is quite basic and not authentic Mexican at all. To top it off, the staff is unfriendly and even at times disdaining.

nAyhe5XXB4nLZOg6XVksaA.text: Great food, margaritas are smooth, service is great. Good value. Just the perfect amount of spicy. Will come back next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pancho Villa's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
